<!-- Don't mess with this line! --><!-- Write your article below this line -->
'''Northwestern International University''' was one of the first colleges to offer self-directed online programs, which were based on review of prior-earned college credits, professional life-experiences, practical knowledge, research, portfolio work, and the passage of [[comprehensive examinations]] *Cite (Northwestern International University Registration Catalog). N.I.U. was a member of the Long Distance Learning Council *Cite (Long Distance Learning Council Catalog). Their admissions process consisted of the initial registration process, student selection, and the review of student work and experience. Students had to show proof of passing content specific exams before being considered for school admission. They were also required to pass comprehensive exams at the completion of their respective program. Furthermore, students were expected to complete a Practicum Learning Portfolio Log. The time-requirement for portfolio hours varied by subject matter. Lastly, students had to successfully complete and present research, before N.I.U. would issue their degree *Cite(Northwestern International University Registration Catalog).
Northwestern International University offered a [[Distance education|long-distance]], blended program that allowed students flexibility in working towards an advanced degree. It enabled them to broaden their professional expertise, and stretch their academic knowledge all on the students own time, and in their own environment *Cite (Northwestern International University Registration Catalog).
==Mission statement== Northwestern International University was committed to developing the potential of each of its students. It provided the opportunity for academic excellence and professional growth. The university created a climate in which all members of the community could freely think, write, research, analyze, share, and criticize *Cite (Northwestern International University Registration Catalog). It was committed to extending university resources to the entire student body. According to their Registration Catalog, the Mission of N.I.U. was to:
#Develop the skills essential to effective learning. #Apply critical thought to decisions in all areas of life. #Exercise responsibility in the local, national, and world community. #Access, select, and prepare students for a career. #Acquire attitudes and understanding necessary for effective human relationships. #Complete degree programs off-campus at a time and site convenient to adult learners.
Based on this model, the program and experience offered high quality content and flexibility. This enabled students to tailor their academic studies and [[coursework]] to fit in with the rest of their schedule *Cite (Northwestern International University Registration Catalog). Northwestern International University truly was an innovative educational and training organization. At the time, its quality set it apart from others in adult long-distance/self-directed/online learning. It was truly unique and a pioneer in its field.
N.I.U. was initially accredited by the Euro-American Accreditation Agency. This organization (and its trustees) ensured the highest possible standards of academic excellence in curriculum design and operational policies in all university programs *Cite (Euro-American Accreditation Agency).
==Decline and Closure== Unfortunately, the academic programs of Northwestern began to decline in 2007. They were no longer considered rigorous, and [[course credit|academic credit]] was being given erroneously, at best (solely based on Life Experience) *Cite (Google). Furthermore, in 2007, the university’s accreditation had been cancelled. In 2008, the Accreditation Agency itself had been disbanded. After the university reconfigured itself, students also “lost” credit for some prior coursework. N.I.U. was officially closed in 2009 *Cite (Consumer Protection). Many states and nations do not accept their coursework, credit, and degrees if obtained after 2007 *Cite (Department of Education). Those that were earned and granted (prior to 2007) are often accepted.
==References== * Northwestern International University Registration Catalog & Website * Long Distance Learning Council Catalog & Website * Euro-American Accreditation Agency Catalog & Website * Google * Consumer Protection Agency * United States Department of Education
[[Category:Distance education]] [[Category:Online colleges]] [[Category:Educational institutions disestablished in 2009]]

{{BLP sources|date=June 2015}} {{Infobox person | image = | name = Olivier Zahm | image_size = 300px | caption = Zahm pictured in 2018 for ''Tecknikart Magazine '' | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1963|09|25}} | birth_place = [[Paris]], [[France]] | nationality = [[French people|French]] | residence = [[Paris]], [[France]] and [[Los Angeles]], [[California]] | education = Université Panthéon-Sorbonne | occupation = [[Magazine editor]], [[photographer]], [[art critic]], [[writer]], [[fashion journalist]] | known_for = Editor-in-chief and co-founder of Purple Magazine | years_active = 1985–present | children = 2 | website = {{url|purple.fr}} }} '''Olivier Zahm''' (born 25 September 1963) is a French [[Editing|magazine editor,]] [[art critic]], [[art director]], [[curator]], writer, and [[photographer]]{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/11/04/fashion/04ZAHM.html|title=Publisher in the Warhol Mold|last=Morgan|first=Spencer|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.thecut.com/2017/11/interview-olivier-zahm-on-the-purple-25th-anniversary.html|title=A French Fashion Editor on the Difference Between Paris, New York, and L.A.|last=Swanson|first=Carl|work=The Cut|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en}}{{Cite web|url=http://purple.fr|title=purple DIARY|website=Purple|language=en-US|access-date=2018-09-23}} He is the co-founder, owner, and current editor-in-chief of the bi-annual [[art]] and [[fashion]] magazine ''[[Purple]].''{{Cite news|url=https://www.lemonde.fr/m-gens-portrait/article/2015/10/09/olivier-zahm-dandy-a-louer_4786361_4497229.html|title=Olivier Zahm, dandy à louer|work=Le Monde.fr|access-date=2018-09-23|language=fr-FR}}[https://www.businessoffashion.com/community/people/olivier-zahm] In addition to his innovative print publishing, he is a recognized pioneering cultural influence at the dawn of the electronic era during ''the [[Digital Revolution]]''[[Digital Revolution|.]] His early blogs{{Cite web|url=http://purple.fr/|title=purple DIARY|website=Purple|language=en-US|access-date=2018-09-23}} garnered notoriety, and featured highly stylized photographs taken by him, that took his audience on daily tours of his fantasyland populated by the artists, intellectuals, designers, filmmakers, socialites, models and celebrities who regularly appeared in his magazine{{Cite news|url=https://www.interviewmagazine.com/culture/olivier-zahm-purple-diary|title=The Man and the Brand: Olivier Zahm - Interview Magazine|date=2010-03-10|work=Interview Magazine|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=http://purple.fr/night/|title=purple NIGHT|work=Purple|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://i-d.vice.com/en_au/article/9kby7d/purple-reign-tbt-to-2010-when-i-d-met-olivier-zahm|title=purple reign: #tbt to 2010, when i-D met olivier zahm|date=2017-05-04|work=I-d|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en-au}}. His [[Aesthetics|aesthetic]] has been described as anti-fashion, [[counterculture]], and unfettered by the constraints of the mainstream publishing world{{Cite web|url=https://www.semipermanent.com/profiles/olivier-zahm|title=Olivier Zahm {{!}} Semi Permanent|website=Semi Permanent|language=en|access-date=2018-09-23}}. His online activity served as an early electronic precursor to popular social media platforms like Facebook and Instagram. His magazine remains one of the only independent and privately owned publications of its kind{{Cite news|url=http://www.papermag.com/olivier-zahm-le-provocateur-1427384256.html|title=Olivier Zahm: Le Provocateur|date=2014-09-07|work=PAPER|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en}}. Created in the beginning of the ''1990s'' - it still remains a major reference for other alternative magazines today{{Cite news|url=http://www.bystylingamsterdam.com/2012/03/05/purples-editor-in-chief-olivier-zahm-accuses-muse-magazine-of-shameless-copying/|title=Purple’s Editor-In-Chief Olivier Zahm accuses Muse Magazine of Shameless Copying!|date=2012-03-05|work=by Styling Amsterdam|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.thecut.com/2012/02/olivier-zahm-accuses-purple.html|title=Olivier Zahm Accuses Muse Magazine of Copying Purple|work=The Cut|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en}}. == Early life and education == [[File:Olivier Zahm in 1979.jpg|thumb|333x333px|Zahm pictured in [[1979]] in [[Paris]]]] Olivier Zahm was born and raised in [[Paris]], France.{{Cite news|url=https://www.businessoffashion.com/community/people/olivier-zahm|title=Olivier Zahmis One of the 500 People Shaping the Global Fashion Industry|work=The Business of Fashion|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-GB}} He was the eldest of three children born to two university professors. His parents, who were both students at the time of his birth, raised Zahm and his other siblings in student quarters that were designed by [[Charlotte Perriand]] and [[Jean Prouvé]], located at [[:fr:Résidence_universitaire_Jean-Zay|Résidence Universitaire Jean-Zay]] in [[Antony, Hauts-de-Seine|Antony]].{{Cite news|url=https://i-d.vice.com/en_us/article/9kby7d/purple-reign-tbt-to-2010-when-i-d-met-olivier-zahm|title=purple reign: #tbt to 2010, when i-D met olivier zahm|date=2017-05-04|work=I-d|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en-us}}  Much of his early childhood was spent in academic settings, particularly- during the volatile period of civil unrest in France that broke out in [[May 1968]]''.''{{Cite news|url=https://i-d.vice.com/en_us/article/9kby7d/purple-reign-tbt-to-2010-when-i-d-met-olivier-zahm|title=purple reign: #tbt to 2010, when i-D met olivier zahm|date=2017-05-04|work=I-d|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en-us}}  The protests reached such a point that political leaders feared civil war or revolution. The unrest began with a series of student occupation protests against [[capitalism]], [[consumerism]], [[American imperialism]], and traditional institutions, values and order. Many of the new and radical ideas surrounding Zahm, immersing his youth in tumultuous generational discord, stayed with him, shaping his views on art, philosophical ideas and lifestyle choices.  He leveraged his profound formative experience using it as a tool to build aspects and themes that remain prevalent in his personal and professional life in adulthood.  He told The [[The New York Times|New York Times]] in 2010 that he, “remembers summers spent vacationing in the South of France with his parents in a community of like minded free spirits”{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/11/04/fashion/04ZAHM.html|title=Publisher in the Warhol Mold|last=Morgan|first=Spencer|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en}} - who he labeled hippies. It was the ''1970s'', the decade of sex revolution and Zahm's parents were committed to [[free love]]'','' [[Naturism|nudism]] and [[Polyamory|polyamourous]] relationships. "My parents had a lot of lovers, they had a lot of affairs. At the time, my parents were really part of this alternative movement in Paris but quite bourgeois too. It wasn't San Francisco or New York. It was the French way{{Cite news|url=https://i-d.vice.com/en_au/article/9kby7d/purple-reign-tbt-to-2010-when-i-d-met-olivier-zahm|title=purple reign: #tbt to 2010, when i-D met olivier zahm|date=2017-05-04|work=I-d|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en-au}}." Zahm’s love of magazines began when he was a teenager in the Paris suburbs. “We used to steal porn magazines in the bookstores and shops and look at them during school,” he says. “It was fun and secret. This is where my obsession for magazines comes from. Magazines used to reveal and give us access to sex, fashion, music and art. TV never did that, and books are mostly academic. Magazines were a symbol of freedom.” {{Cite news|url=https://www.thecut.com/2013/02/olivier-zahm-fashions-most-libidinal-editor.html|title=Riding Around Paris With Olivier Zahm, Fashion’s Most Libidinal Editor|work=The Cut|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en}} He studied [[Philosophy|philosophy,]] [[history]], [[semiotics]] and [[literature]] at the [[Sorbonne University|Sorbonne]]{{Cite news|url=https://www.parismatch.com/Culture/Livres/Olivier-Zahm-l-anar-chic-purple-Fashion-156808|title=Olivier Zahm, l’anar chic|last=Match|first=Paris|access-date=2018-09-24|language=fr-FR}}. His father, Claude, taught philosophy, and Zahm was on track to do the same, before realizing, at 25, that he preferred life outside “la tour d’ ivoire.” {{Cite news|url=https://www.thecut.com/2013/02/olivier-zahm-fashions-most-libidinal-editor.html|title=Riding Around Paris With Olivier Zahm, Fashion’s Most Libidinal Editor|work=The Cut|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en}} Zahm's youngest sister committed suicide in 1994 at the age of 20. {{Cite news|url=https://www.thecut.com/2013/02/olivier-zahm-fashions-most-libidinal-editor.html|title=Riding Around Paris With Olivier Zahm, Fashion’s Most Libidinal Editor|work=The Cut|access-date=2018-10-29|language=en}} == Career == Before entering the world of fashion, Zahm worked as an art critic with widespread recognition for his work as a curator as well as his participation in over 150 exhibitions featuring international contemporary art. {{Cite web|url=https://magpile.com/purple-prose/2/|title=Purple Prose , #2|website=Magpile|access-date=2018-09-24}}In responding to the superficial glamour of the 1980s, Zahm co-founded Purple Prose magazine{{Cite web|url=https://magpile.com/purple-prose/about/|title=Purple Prose magazine on Magpile|website=magpile.com|access-date=2018-09-23}}. In the introduction of Purple Anthology, Zahm shares why he chose to create Purple Prose:{{Cite news|url=https://www.rizzoliusa.com/book/9780847830206/|title=Purple Anthology: Art Prose Fashion Music Architecture Sex - Rizzoli New York|work=Rizzoli New York|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=http://purple.fr/magazine/fw-2008-issue-10/purple-anthology/|title=Purple Anthology - purple MAGAZINE|work=Purple|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en-US}}
''"We launched Purple Prose in the early 1990s without any means, and without any experience, because we wanted to make a magazine that was radically different. We wanted to support the artists around us that no one else supported, much less talked about. It would be a form of opposition of our own".'' {{Cite book|title=Purple Anthology|last=Zahm|first=Olivier|last2=Fleiss|first2=Elein|publisher=Rizzoli|year=2008|isbn=978-0-8478-3020-6|location=New York City|pages=introduction}}{{Cite book|url=https://www.amazon.com/Purple-Anthology-Prose-Fashion-Architecture/dp/0847830209|title=Purple Anthology: Art Prose Fashion Music Architecture Sex|date=2008-05-27|publisher=Rizzoli|isbn=9780847830206|editor-last=Zahm|editor-first=Olivier|location=New York|language=English|editor-last2=Fleiss|editor-first2=Elein}}
=== Art critic and curator (1985–1994) === During the beginning of the 80’s Zahm started to observe and take an interest in the art world. He liked the notion of “being everywhere and on the move”, following art fairs, meeting artists, educating himself in the universe of contemporary art while immersing himself into its social landscape.  Zahm’s gift of being a charismatic intellectual and having an eye for contemporary art made itself apparent early on. He found himself penning for the three leading art titles at the time [[Artforum|Art Forum]], Art Flash, [[Texte zur Kunst|Texte Zur Kunst]] and [[Art press|Art Presse]] and introduced a then unknown [[Jeff Koons]], [[Martin Kippenberger]], and [[Larry Clark]] to the European art world.   He started traveling to the United States and Japan, realizing he could set up his own operation and work agenda, 24/7. He told [[I-D|I-D magazine]] in 2010: [[File:Jan Van Osst, Sans titre, 1993.jpg|thumb|Jan Van Osst, Sans Titre, 1993 at L'Hiver De L'amour in [[Musée d'Art Moderne de la Ville de Paris|Musée d'Art Moderne de la Ville Paris]] curated by Zahm]]
"Freedom for me came from the art world because it was a place where I could meet the artists. I wanted to be a social critic. I was more interested in the category of intellectual, involving art and politics and writing sometimes. But I didn't want to be a writer necessarily, I just wanted to be part of an intellectual world." {{Cite news|url=https://i-d.vice.com/en_au/article/9kby7d/purple-reign-tbt-to-2010-when-i-d-met-olivier-zahm|title=purple reign: #tbt to 2010, when i-D met olivier zahm|date=2017-05-04|work=I-d|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en-au}} 
In 1989, while working at [[Artforum]],  Elien Fleiss, then a young gallery curator received a phone call from Zahm. She was looking for an art critic to write a manifesto against a journalist from a daily newspaper who she felt was writing insanities about contemporary art in general. Zahm agreed to do it, and that was the beginning of the encounter, which then became a love story. Their romance was short-lived, but their professional relationship was fruitful.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/11/04/fashion/04ZAHM.html|title=Publisher in the Warhol Mold|last=Morgan|first=Spencer|access-date=2018-09-23|language=en}}  In 1994, they curated “The Winter of Love,”https://www.moma.org/calendar/exhibitions/4589 a hit show for the [[Musée d'Art Moderne de la Ville de Paris|Museum of Modern Art in Paris]] that they later took to [[MoMA PS1|P.S. 1]] in [[New York City|New York]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.moma.org/calendar/exhibitions/4589|title=The Winter of Love (L'Hiver de l'Amour) {{!}} MoMA|website=www.moma.org|language=en|access-date=2018-09-23}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.pressreader.com/france/art-press/20170521/282626032622730|title=PressReader.com - Connecting People Through News|website=www.pressreader.com|access-date=2018-09-23}} In May of  2017, Zahm published a book in collaboration with Donation Grau titled,' Une avant-garde sans avant-garde'.{{Cite web|url=http://www.lespressesdureel.com/ouvrage.php?id=3523|title=Olivier Zahm: Une avant-garde sans avant-garde – Les presses du réel (livre)|website=www.lespressesdureel.com|access-date=2018-09-24}}{{Cite news|url=https://i-d.vice.com/fr/article/3kbd8v/sans-dieu-ni-maitres-petite-lecon-davant-gardisme-par-olivier-zahm|title=sans dieu ni maitre, petite leçon d'avant-gardisme par olivier zahm|date=2017-04-25|work=I-d|access-date=2018-09-24|language=fr}}The book is a collection of Zahm’s most significant texts written during the last 30 years. It is above all a radical reading of art from the 1990s to the present. The [[anthology]] tries to decipher this chaotic, contradictory, oppressive, and ultra-creative period. The introductions that precede each chapter contextualize the selected texts, and develop the idea that the 1990s invented an avant-garde without an avant-garde, the issues of which are increasing and intensifying.{{Cite web|url=http://www.lespressesdureel.com/ouvrage.php?id=3523|title=Olivier Zahm: Une avant-garde sans avant-garde – Les presses du réel (livre)|website=www.lespressesdureel.com|access-date=2018-09-24}} {{Cite book|url=https://www.amazon.fr/Une-avant-garde-sans-Olivier-Zahm/dp/2840665441|title=Une avant-garde sans avant-garde|last=recherche|first=résultats de|last2=Grau|first2=Donatien|date=2017-03-01|publisher=Les Presses du réel|isbn=9782840665441|location=Dijon; Zurich}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.jrp-ringier.com/pages/index.php?id_r=4&id_t=&id_p=18&id_b=2748|title=Olivier Zahm - Une avant-garde sans avant-garde|website=jrp-ringier|access-date=2018-09-24}}{{Cite web|url=https://livre.fnac.com/a10494503/Olivier-Zahm-Une-avant-garde-sans-avant-garde|title=Une avant-garde sans avant-garde Essai sur l'art - broché - Olivier Zahm - Achat Livre {{!}} fnac|website=livre.fnac.com|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-09-26}}{{Cite news|url=http://purple.fr/diary/olivier-zahms-new-book-une-avant-garde-sans-avant-garde-co-edited-with-donatien-grau-is-available-now-to-pre-order/|title=Olivier Zahm's new book "Une avant-garde sans avant-garde" co-edited with Donatien Grau is available now to pre-order! - purple DIARY|date=2017-02-23|work=Purple|access-date=2018-09-26|language=en-US}} === Purple === ==== Early day's of ''Purple'' (1992–2004) ==== Zahm gravitated towards the idea of working with magazines from the conception of his career in art. In 1992 Zahm and his partner Elien Fleiss printed the first issue of Purple Prose, a Parisian literary art zine.{{Cite news|url=https://www.ravelinmagazine.com/posts/les-chroniques-purple/|title=Les Chroniques Purple - Ravelin Magazine|date=2014-08-13|work=Ravelin Magazine|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.ebay.com/itm/PURPLE-PROSE-MAGAZINE-ISSUE-1-1992-OLIVIER-ZAHM-ELEIN-FLEISS-RARE-/121033472335|title=PURPLE PROSE MAGAZINE ISSUE #1 1992 OLIVIER ZAHM, ELEIN FLEISS *RARE* {{!}} eBay|website=eBay|language=en|access-date=2018-09-24}} Their goal was to create a new kind of space for artists to present their work and express their ideas; and to design a network through which people working in different disciplines, could easily access new information and each other and contributing to the early 90s alternative indie culture.{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/the-colour-purple-1249204.html|title=The colour purple|work=The Independent|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-GB}} {{Cite news|url=https://www.businessoffashion.com/articles/creative-class/olivier-zahms-cocktail-of-intellect-sex-and-the-seventies|title=Olivier Zahm’s Cocktail of Intellect, Sex and the Seventies|date=2015-05-27|work=The Business of Fashion|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-GB}} Zahm liked the idea of a color sharing the title with an art magazine. [[Dike Blair]] an American artist suggested the title Purple Prose in reference to the literary term in which a prose text is so extravagent, ornate, or flowery that it breaks the flow and draws excessive attention to itself.{{Cite news|url=https://www.thecut.com/2017/11/interview-olivier-zahm-on-the-purple-25th-anniversary.html|title=A French Fashion Editor on the Difference Between Paris, New York, and L.A.|last=Swanson|first=Carl|work=The Cut|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en}}  Soon after the birth of Purple Prose, Zahm created spin-off publications like Purple Sexe, Purple Fiction and Purple Fashion. Zahm aimed at fusing together his two worlds, fashion and art, in creating Purple Fashion.{{Cite web|url=https://magpile.com/purple-prose/1/|title=Purple Prose , #1|website=Magpile|access-date=2018-09-24}}  A typical issue featured interviews, articles and presentations covering a wide range of topics and disciplines which include; film and video, politics, fashion, architecture, sexuality, science, photography and music. Each issue was built around a loose theme which serves to create a link between subjects-past examples have been: Indian Summer, Violet Violence, Post-Sex. With its international correspondents and cutting-edge design, Purple Prose had the distinctive feel of a truly global art zine. The texts were written in roughly equal parts French and English, without translations.{{Cite web|url=http://adaweb.walkerart.org/purple/info.html|title=Purple Prose|website=adaweb.walkerart.org|access-date=2018-09-24}} For many years the magazine was associated with a realist esthetic, that of the new photography of the early 1990s- of photographers like [[Juergen Teller]], [[Terry Richardson]], [[Wolfgang Tillmans]], and [[Mario Sorrenti]].  From a visual standpoint, the magazine represented a break from 80s imagery (like [[Richard Avedon]]’s photography for [[Versace]], for example.){{Cite news|url=https://tmagazine.blogs.nytimes.com/2008/05/30/fine-print-the-purple-anthology/?mtrref=www.google.com&gwh=2D16E914473B5E10578FBC9B4FEF8E2C&gwt=pay|title=Fine Print {{!}} 'The Purple Anthology'|last=Hruska|first=Jordan|work=T Magazine|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}} From an artistic standpoint, the artists from the early 1990s were raising up against art as a capitalist fetish; they were aligning themselves with the artistic social and political practices of the 1970s-- those of performance, [[video art]], [[Fluxus]], and the conceptual and minimalist [[avant-garde]]. The magazine was an integral part of this burgeoning context, which included the deconstruction of fashion by [[Martin Margiela]]{{Cite news|url=http://purple.fr/magazine/ss-2007-issue-7/retrospective-maison-martin-margiela/|title=Retrospective Maison Martin Margiela - purple MAGAZINE|work=Purple|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}} and [[Comme des Garçons|Comme des Garçsons]]{{Cite news|url=http://purple.fr/magazine/fw-2012-issue-18/rei-kawakubo/|title=Rei Kawakubo - purple MAGAZINE|work=Purple|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}}; the return of subtle political art, with that of [[Félix González-Torres|Felix Gonzalez- Torres]], [[Maurizio Cattelan]], and [[Philippe Parreno]], among others; photography of [[Juergen Teller]]; and [[Harmony Korine]] and [[Larry Clark]]’s independent filmmaking.{{Cite news|url=http://purple.fr/magazine/ss-2013-issue-19/harmony-korine/|title=Harmony Korine - purple MAGAZINE|work=Purple|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=http://purple.fr/magazine/ss-2013-issue-19/larry-clark/|title=Larry Clark - purple MAGAZINE|work=Purple|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}} ==== ''Purple Magazine'' (2017–present) ==== For its 25th anniversary issue{{Cite news|url=https://www.thecut.com/2017/11/interview-olivier-zahm-on-the-purple-25th-anniversary.html|title=A French Fashion Editor on the Difference Between Paris, New York, and L.A.|last=Swanson|first=Carl|work=The Cut|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en}}, Purple celebrated the artists and models who incarnated the spirit of the magazine through their style, attitude, and personality: [[Cindy Sherman]], [[Wolfgang Tillmans]], [[Chloë Sevigny|Chloe Savigny]], [[Richard Prince]], [[Paul McCarthy]], [[Susan Cianciolo]] , [[Maurizio Cattelan|Maurizio Cattelan,]] and more.{{Cite news|url=https://www.standardhotels.com/culture/photos-purple-magazine-top-of-the-standard-september-2017|title=PHOTOS: Purple Magazine's 25th Anniversary Party at Top of The Standard|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=http://purple.fr/magazine/purple-25yrs-anniversary-issue/purple-25-years-25-covers/|title=Purple 25 Years 25 covers - purple MAGAZINE|work=Purple|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}} {{Cite news|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/purple-magazine-anniversary-ralph-lauren-paris-fashion-week|title=Purple Magazine Celebrates Its 25th Anniversary With Ralph Lauren in Paris|work=Vogue|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en}}It was the first time the magazine printed multiple covers for one issue. 25 different covers showed  25 Purple icons.{{Cite news|url=http://purple.fr/diary/purple-25th-anniversary-issue-is-out-now/|title=PURPLE 25TH ANNIVERSARY ISSUE IS OUT NOW! - purple DIARY|date=2017-09-05|work=Purple|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.zadig-et-voltaire.com/eu/fr/zadig-backstage/zadig-backstage-society/zadigtribu-purple-25-zadigetvoltaire/|title=Purple 25th anniversary party with Zadig & Voltaire, New York|website=Zadig&Voltaire|language=fr|access-date=2018-09-24}} It was also the first time purple distributed hard-cover magazines instead of the traditional soft-cover print.{{Cite news|url=https://wwd.com/eye/parties/purple-magazine-25th-anniversary-olivier-zahm-chloe-sevigny-grace-hartzel-caroline-vreeland-11006313/|title=Purple Magazine Celebrates 25th Anniversary, Founder’s Birthday|last=Templeton|first=Lily|date=2017-09-26|work=WWD|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}} {{Cite news|url=https://wwd.com/eye/people/purple-reign-10970276/|title=Purple Reign|last=Foreman|first=Katya|date=2017-09-05|work=WWD|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}}He described in the editions Edito:
“It’s been years now that younger generations don’t use magazines to express themselves — at least not the way we did back in 1992. Social media now generally satisfy the need for images, contacts, and creativity. Publishing a magazine has become so expensive… An actual print object like Purple is a luxury item, which is why new alternative magazines don’t last more than a few years, are often bought, or simply disappear. Doing a luxury magazine today is one of the paradoxes of the Instagram era, when such things cost nothing… A magazine is not an ego trip… It’s a collective work by a group of creative people who believe in the artistic value of the print media and share a similar vision. (Thanks to all of them!) Every image, every single text, the choice of paper, the layout, even the choice of typefaces matters. Everything matters… Purple is made to last. Purple is made to capture a moment every season… In this period of global Internet obsession and digital amnesia, I think that means something{{Cite news|url=http://purple.fr/diary/purple-25th-anniversary-issue-is-out-now/|title=PURPLE 25TH ANNIVERSARY ISSUE IS OUT NOW! - purple DIARY|date=2017-09-05|work=Purple|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}}"
In 2017 Purple moved their US based headquarters and offices from [[New York City]] to [[Los Angeles]]. {{Cite news|url=https://wwd.com/business-news/media/purples-l-a-times-1202780271/|title=Purple’s L.A. Times|last=Foreman|first=Katya|date=2018-08-30|work=WWD|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://milk.xyz/articles/1955-milk-los-angeles-the-purple-magazine-party/|title=Milk Los Angeles – The Purple Magazine Party {{!}} Milk|last=Jon|date=2013-03-28|work=Milk|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}} === Freelance editor === In the year 2000, [[Serge July]], the founder and editor-in-chief of French national newspaper [[Libération]] hired Olivier Zahm to launch Liberation Style{{Cite web|url=http://www.ideanow.online/liberation.html|title=Liberation Style|website=www.ideanow.online|language=en|access-date=2018-09-24}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.parismatch.com/Culture/Livres/Olivier-Zahm-l-anar-chic-purple-Fashion-156808|title=Olivier Zahm, l’anar chic|last=Match|first=Paris|access-date=2018-09-24|language=fr-FR}}, an occasional Saturday supplement to the main paper. 15 issues were published every season until 2005. *Issue 1: Le Retour Paris *Issue 2: Personnalité Multiple *Issue 3: Plein Soleil *Issue 4: L’empire des Signes *Issue 5: Glamour *Issue 6: Special Creation *Issue 7: L’autre Amérique *Issue 8: La nuit *Issue 9: Femmes *Issue 10: Tokyo *Issue 11: Milan *Issue 12: Les Années Fatales *Issue 13: Best of L’ete 2005 *Issue 14: Special Hommes *Issue 15: Mystere Karl {{Cite web|url=https://www.liberation.fr/auteur/9971-olivier-zahm|title=Olivier ZAHM|website=Libération.fr|language=fr|access-date=2018-09-24}}{{Cite news|url=https://strip-project.com/archive/9-magazine/the-sisterhood-photography-anette-aurell-i-d-magazine-december-2001-january-2002/687|title=THE SISTERHOOD {{!}} PHOTOGRAPHY ANETTE AURELL {{!}} i-D MAGAZINE {{!}} DECEMBER 2001/JANUARY 2002|last=annaka|date=2016-05-11|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-gb}} In 2009 [[Chanel]] launched its very first magazine: 31 Rue Cambon. Chanel’s goal was to combine sales and information. [[Karl Lagerfeld]] delegated the artistic direction of the magazine which was not available to the public, but instead only the private cliental of Chanel to Zahm {{Cite web|url=https://www.tendances-de-mode.com/2009/11/17/1549-31-rue-cambon-le-magazine-chanel|title=31 Rue Cambon : le magazine Chanel - Tendances de Mode|website=www.tendances-de-mode.com|language=fr|access-date=2018-09-24}}{{Cite news|url=http://purple.fr/diary/the-new-chanel-magazine-31-rue-cambon-issue-3/|title=THE NEW CHANEL MAGAZINE, 31 RUE CAMBON, issue #3 - purple DIARY|date=2011-02-05|work=Purple|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.elle.com/fashion/news/a5892/olivier-zahm-made-a-corporate-mag-for-chanel-16120/|title=Olivier Zahm Made A 'Corporate Mag' for Chanel|date=2011-02-23|work=ELLE|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}} In 2018 Zahm designed a fanzine for [[Gucci]]’s FW2019 collection presented at [[Le Palace]] in Paris. The magazine was the 14th issue of Le Palace Magazine. {{Cite web|url=https://www.gucci.com/us/en/st/stories/inspirations-and-codes/article/spring-summer-2019-le-palace-magazine-fanzine|title=A new issue of Le Palace’s fanzine celebrating Gucci Spring Summer 2019 show by Alessandro Michele, with Purple’s Olivier Zahm and photos by Martin Parr.|website=www.gucci.com|language=en|access-date=2018-10-29}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/french-press-gucci-releases-new-issue-of-cult-fanzine-le-palace|title=Gucci Caps Off Its Paris Takeover by Releasing a New Issue of the Cult Fanzine, Le Palace|work=Vogue|access-date=2018-10-29|language=en}} == Photography == Zahm credited Lagerfeld for reigniting his sentiment for taking photos in 2005.  Zahm told WWD in an interview dedicated to Purple’s 25th Anniversary{{Cite news|url=https://wwd.com/eye/people/purple-reign-10970276/|title=Purple Reign|last=Foreman|first=Katya|date=2017-09-05|work=WWD|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}}:
“He (Lagerfeld) was buying these little digital cameras at the time, Sony Cyber-shots, a little pocket-size, flat, digital camera. He had a pile of them on his table and said: “Take this, if you’ll use it.” We had this long discussion about photography and I said, “Karl how can you want to be a photographer when you were friends with [[Helmut Newton]] because, me, I have [[Juergen Teller]] in my generation and I haven’t been able to do photography since I’ve known him, because he’s the best.” And he said: “Olivier, shut up. You don’t understand, photography is not about getting the right picture, it’s about documenting your everyday life. Remember [[Andy Warhol|Warhol]], do you think he was a good photographer? He always had a camera on him. Do like Warhol, do like me: Don’t let a day go by without taking a picture.”{{Cite news|url=https://wwd.com/eye/people/purple-reign-10970276/|title=Purple Reign|last=Foreman|first=Katya|date=2017-09-05|work=WWD|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-US}}
In 2009, he began documenting his late-night partying escapades in high-contrast black-and-white photographs which appeared on Purple Diary{{Cite news|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2014/09/09/fashion-s-naughtiest-photographer-olivier-zahm|title=Fashion’s Naughtiest Photographer, Olivier Zahm|last=Jones|first=Justin|date=2014-09-09|work=The Daily Beast|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en}}, a notorious photo blog that would become the seed for a full Purple website. He has had shows of his photographic work at Half Gallery in New York, Colette in Paris , Leadapron in Los Angeles and The Last Gallery in Tokyo. {{Cite news|url=https://www.refinery29.com/olivier-zahm-s-secrets-of-photographing-women-exhibition-opens-tomorrow-at-leadapron-gallery|title=Purple's Olivier Zahm Launches A Photo Exhibit In L.A.|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://hypebeast.com/2010/3/olivier-zahm-purple-diary-exhibition-colette|title=Olivier Zahm "Purple Diary" Exhibition @ colette|work=HYPEBEAST|access-date=2018-09-24}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.jsbg.me/2011/05/26/%E2%80%9Cthe-secrets-of-photographing-women%E2%80%9D-lexpo-olivier-zahm/|title=“The Secrets of Photographing Women”, l’expo Olivier Zahm|work=JSBG.me|access-date=2018-09-24|language=fr-FR}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.semipermanent.com/profiles/olivier-zahm|title=Olivier Zahm {{!}} Semi Permanent|website=Semi Permanent|language=en|access-date=2018-09-24}} In addition to documenting his personal life on social media platform he continues to shoot many editorials and campaigns for various brands including [[Yves Saint Laurent (brand)|Yves Saint Laurent]], [[Chanel]], [[Giorgio Armani]], [[Uniqlo]],  [[Agent Provocateur (lingerie)|Agent Provocateur]], and magazines including [[Lui]], Vogue Russia, and Kadewe among others. {{Cite web|url=https://www.portraitsofgirls.com/photographer/olivier-zahm/|title=Olivier Zahm Archives — Portraits Of Girls|website=Portraits Of Girls|language=en-US|access-date=2018-09-24}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/lifestyle/2017/03/03/30001-20170303ARTFIG00275-olivier-zahm-l-art-du-present.php|title=Olivier Zahm, l'art du présent|date=2017-03-03|work=FIGARO|access-date=2018-09-24|language=fr-FR}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.luimagazine.fr/sexy/fille-sexy/hedy-olivier-zham-morena/|title=Hedy vue par… Olivier Zahm|date=2015-09-21|work=LUI|access-date=2018-09-24|language=fr-FR}}{{Cite news|url=https://models.com/people/olivier-zahm|title=Olivier Zahm - Photographer|work=MODELS.com|access-date=2018-09-24}} In 2014, Zahm partnered with [[Rizzoli Bookstore|Rizzoli]] published O.Z. Diary, a cosmopolitan 500-page photo diary exposing the lifestyles of the creative elite through a series of intimate, autobiographical photographs. [[Glenn O'Brien]] contributed various texts for the book.{{Cite news|url=https://www.rizzoliusa.com/book/9780847841387/|title=O.Z.: Olivier Zahm: Diary - Rizzoli New York|work=Rizzoli New York|access-date=2018-09-26|language=en-US}}{{Citation|last=Marc Jacobs|title=O.Z.: Olivier Zahm: Diary|date=2014-10-17|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2D_pyF4urBo|access-date=2018-09-26}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.onetshirt.eu/blogs/onetlikes/15770249-oz-diary-a-photographic-diary-of-fashion-art-and-sex-by-olivier-zahm|title=OZ Diary. A photographic diary of Fashion, Art and Sex by Olivier Zahm – ONETSHIRT|website=www.onetshirt.eu|language=en|access-date=2018-09-26}} == Personal life == Zahm has a son, Balthus, with designer Natacha Ramsay-Levi{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/fashion/people/natacha-ramsay-levi-meet-paris-it-girl-has-just-named-creative/|title=Who is Natacha Ramsay-Levi? Meet the Paris It-girl who has just been named creative director at Chloé|last=Leaper|first=Caroline|date=2017-03-10|work=The Telegraph|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en-GB|issn=0307-1235}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/09/27/fashion/chloe-natacha-ramsay-levi-paris-fashion-week.html|title=The New Chloé Girl|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.thecut.com/2010/07/olivier_zahms_girlfriend_dumpe.html|title=Olivier Zahm’s Girlfriend Dumped Him and He Blogged About It|work=The Cut|access-date=2018-09-24|language=en}}, and a daughter, Asia, with writer Anna Dubosc. He currently is in a relationship with creative director and former model Amanda Wall. He splits his time between Los Angeles and Paris.{{Cite news|url=https://www.thecut.com/2013/02/olivier-zahm-fashions-most-libidinal-editor.html|title=Riding Around Paris With Olivier Zahm, Fashion’s {{Use mdy dates|date=December 2011}} {{Infobox person |name=Peter Martins |image=Peter Martins Shankbone Metropolitan Opera 2009.jpg |caption=Martins at the opening night of the 2009 [[Metropolitan Opera]] |birth_date={{birth date and age|df=yes|1946|10|27}} |birth_place=[[Copenhagen]], Denmark |residence=[[Manhattan, New York City, New York]] |occupation=Dancer, choreographer |spouse=[[Darci Kistler]] (m. 1991) Lise la Cour |children=Talicia Tove Martins, Nilas Martins<ref>http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/ballet-dancer-pleads-guilty-cocaine-charges-article-1.237922</ref> }} '''Peter Martins''' (born 27 October 1946) is a Danish [[ballet dancer]] and [[choreographer]]. Martins was a [[principal dancer]] with the [[Royal Danish Ballet]] and with the [[New York City Ballet]], where he joined [[George Balanchine]], [[Jerome Robbins]], and [[John Taras]] as [[Ballet master|balletmaster]] in 1981. He retired from dancing in 1983, having achieved the rank of [[danseur noble]], becoming Co-Ballet Master-In-Chief with Robbins. From 1990 until January 2018, he was solely responsible for artistic leadership of City Ballet.
In December 2017, Martins took a leave of absence from the New York City Ballet following an allegation of sexual misconduct made against him.<ref name=Wingenroth>{{Cite news|author= Lauren Wingenroth|url=http://www.dancemagazine.com/peter-martins-leave-absence-accusations-2515881048.html|date=December 8, 2017|title=Peter Martins Is Taking A Leave of Absence As More Accusations Surface|work=Dance}}</ref><ref name="PogrebinLeave">Robin Pogrebin, [https://www.nytimes.com/2017/12/07/arts/dance/city-ballets-peter-martins-takes-leave-of-absence-after-misconduct-accusation.html City Ballet's Peter Martins Takes Leave of Absence After Misconduct Accusation], ''New York Times'' (December 7, 2017).</ref> Five City Ballet dancers later told the ''New York Times'' that Martins had verbally or physical abused them; Martins denied engaging in any misconduct.<ref>Robin Pogrebin, [https://www.nytimes.com/2017/12/12/arts/dance/peter-martins-ballet-new-york-city-physical-abuse.html Five Dancers Accuse City Ballet’s Peter Martins of Physical Abuse], ''New York Times'' (December 12, 2017).</ref><ref name="Pogrebin2018">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/01/arts/dance/peter-martins-resigns-ballet.html|title=Peter Martins Retires From New York City Ballet After Misconduct Allegations|last=Pogrebin|first=Robin|date=January 1, 2018|work=The New York Times}}</ref> Martins retired from the City Ballet on January 1, 2018.<ref name="Pogrebin2018"/> A subsequent joint inquiry commissioned by the City Ballet and its School of American Ballet "did not corroborate the allegations of harassment or violence" made against Martins.<ref name="PogrebinInquiry">Robin Pogrebin, [https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/15/arts/dance/peter-martins-ballet-investigation.html Abuse Accusations Against Peter Martins Are Not Corroborated, Inquiry Says], ''New York Times'' (February 15, 2018).</ref>
==Early life==
Martins was born and raised in [[Copenhagen]], Denmark.<ref name=autogenerated7>Mary Ellen Snodgrass (2015). [https://books.google.com/books?id=DNvaCQAAQBAJ&pg=PA196&lpg=PA196&dq=%22Peter+Martins%22+copenhagen+born&source=bl&ots=2WlyKhXrGg&sig=5yVGw8_TDfcMGNZE728v96zhmng&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiuiM7CorrYAhWElOAKHcMfBmcQ6AEIpwEwGg#v=onepage&q=%22Peter%20Martins%22%20copenhagen%20born&f=false ''The Encyclopedia of World Ballet,''<!-- Bot generated title -->] Rowman & Littlefield.</ref> His parents were Børge Martins, an engineer, and Tove Christa Ornberg, a pianist.<ref name=autogenerated7 /> His maternal aunt and uncle, Leif and Elna Ornberg, members of the Royal Danish Ballet, started teaching him ballroom combinations when he was five years of age; when he applied to ballet school, however, he was the subject of discrimination because his aunt and uncle had been [[Nazi sympathizer]]s.<ref name=autogenerated7 /> It was his older sisters who originally tried-out for the Royal Ballet of Denmark at the age of seven. When they did, he was sitting in the waiting room reading a Donald Duck comic book. They were denied admittance. The asked Peter to "point his foot". He did especially well and was admitted.
==Career==
Martins began his ballet training in 1953 with the [[Royal Danish Ballet]]. He joined the [[corps de ballet]] in 1965, and was promoted to [[Soloist (ballet)|soloist]] in 1967.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.britannica.com/biography/Peter-Martins|title=Peter Martins {{!}} Danish dancer|work=Encyclopedia Britannica|access-date=2017-12-31|language=en}}</ref>
Martins left Denmark in 1970 and became a [[principal dancer]] with the New York City Ballet (NYCB), though he had been performing as a guest artist since 1967.<ref name=autogenerated1>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=5507420&privcapId=5507480&previousCapId=5507480&previousTitle=New%20York%20City%20Ballet,%20Inc.|title=Peter Martins: Executive Profile & Biography - Bloomberg|website=www.bloomberg.com|access-date=2017-12-31}}</ref> Martins danced a wide variety of roles, but is most known for the titular role in ''[[Apollo (ballet)|Apollo]]'' and the Cavalier in Balanchine's ''[[The Nutcracker|Nutcracker]]''. He danced frequently with [[Suzanne Farrell]]. However, he terminated her employment with the NYCB in 1993; she went on to found her own company, which disbanded in 2017.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1993/08/04/arts/city-ballet-breaks-off-its-long-relationship-with-suzanne-farrell.html|title=City Ballet Breaks Off Its Long Relationship With Suzanne Farrell|last=Dunning|first=Jennifer|date=1993-08-04|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-12-31|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/theater_dance/suzanne-farrell-ballet-to-disband-in-2017/2016/09/21/c9877a2e-8025-11e6-b002-307601806392_story.html|title=Suzanne Farrell Ballet to disband in 2017|last=Kaufman|first=Sarah L.|date=2016-09-21|work=Washington Post|access-date=2017-12-31|language=en-US|issn=0190-8286}}</ref>
Martins retired from dancing in 1983, becoming Co-Ballet Master-In-Chief alongside Jerome Robbins,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1983/12/11/arts/dance-view-two-special-dancers-leave-the-stage.html|title=Dance View; Two Special Dancers Leave the Stage|last=Kisselgoff|first=Anna|date=1983-12-11|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-12-31|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> and assumed the job of sole Balletmaster-in-Chief in 1990. Martins was Balanchine's personal choice of successor. However, early in his career as balletmaster, Martins faced criticism for perceived deviations from Balanchine's style.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1988-05-29/entertainment/ca-5680_1_city-ballet|title=Dance: An Identity Crisis at the New York City Ballet|last=Bernheimer|first=Martin|date=1988-05-29|work=Los Angeles Times|access-date=2017-12-31|language=en-US|issn=0458-3035}}</ref> Martins also served as the artistic director and chairman of faculty of the [[School of American Ballet]], the training division of the NYCB and the venue through which it receives most of its dancers.<ref name=autogenerated3 /> From 1990 until January 2018, he was solely responsible for artistic leadership of City Ballet.<ref name=autogenerated3>{{Cite web|url=https://sab.org/school/faculty/peter_martins_artistic_directorchairman_of_faculty.php|title=Peter Martins, Artistic Director/Chairman of Faculty {{!}} The School of American Ballet|website=sab.org|access-date=2017-12-31}}</ref> He was the subject of the 1991 documentary ''Peter Martins: A Dancer''. In 2005 his salary was $619,000, and in 2008 he received $699,000 in pay and benefits.<ref>[http://nymag.com/guides/salary/14497/index4.html Who Makes How Much - New York's Salary Guide 2005<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[https://artsbeat.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/07/22/2008-tax-returns-city-ballet-salaries/ 2008 Tax Returns: City Ballet Salaries - The New York Times<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Martins regularly choreographed new works for both companies. His first piece was ''[[Calcium Light Night]]'', set to music by [[Charles Ives]], which premiered in 1977. His more recent pieces include ''[[Octet (Martins)|Octet]]'', ''[[Friandises]]'', [[Stabat Mater]] and the full-length ballets ''[[The Sleeping Beauty (ballet)|The Sleeping Beauty]]'', ''[[Swan Lake]]'', and [[Romeo + Juliet (ballet)|''Romeo ''+'' Juliet'']].<ref name=autogenerated1 /> He also choreographed the Barbie movies ''[[Barbie in the Nutcracker]]'' and ''[[Barbie of Swan Lake]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1019857/|title=Peter Martins|website=IMDb|access-date=2017-12-31}}</ref> In 2000, Martins, along with talent scout [[Irene Diamond]], founded the New York Choreographic Institute<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nycballet.com/About/New-York-Choreographic-Institute|title=New York Choreographic Institute|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>.
===Allegations of sexual assault=== In December 2017, an investigation was announced by New York City Ballet into accusations by dancers within the company of [[Assault|physical]] and [[sexual assault]] by Martins, and using his power to obtain sexual favors, dating back to 1983.<ref name=autogenerated2>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dancemagazine.com/peter-martins-leave-absence-accusations-2515881048.html|title=Peter Martins Is Taking A Leave of Absence As More Accusations Surface|date=2017-12-08|work=dancemagazine|access-date=2017-12-31|language=en}}</ref> One of his accusers, Wilhelmina Frankfurt, a former New York City Ballet ballerina and later a dance educator, said: "Am I a victim of Martins abuse? Yes. Was it sexual? Yes. Was it consensual? No [...] It was scary. One incident that occurred [...] He [...] pulled me into his dressing room and, exposed himself to me. [And one incident is] so big I don’t think I can talk about it."<ref>https://www.salon.com/2018/01/08/peter-martins-sexual-misconduct-wilhelmina-frankfurt/</ref>
Martins took a leave of absence that month from both the New York City Ballet and its School of the American Ballet, after the allegations came to light, and in January 2018 he retired.<ref>Kate Feldman (January 1, 2018). [http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/peter-martins-retire-new-york-city-ballet-claims-article-1.3732231 "Ballet guru Peter Martins retiring amid sex harassment claims,"<!-- Bot generated title -->] ''NY Daily News''.</ref> Martins denied any misconduct.<ref>Ray Sanchez and Laura Ly (January 2, 2018). [http://www.cnn.com/2018/01/02/us/new-york-city-ballet-peter-martins/index.html "Peter Martins retires from NYC Ballet amid sexual harassment allegations,"<!-- Bot generated title -->] CNN.</ref> A two-month investigation of the New York City Ballet and its School of the American Ballet "did not corroborate the allegations of harassment or violence both made in the anonymous letter and reported in the media regarding Mr. Martins".<ref name="PogrebinInquiry"/> This was not a criminal investigation and was conducted by NYCB, Inc.'s own attorneys.
==Awards, collaborations, and written work== He received a Dance Magazine Award<ref>[https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/the-56th-annual-dance-magazine-awards-230660971.html "The 56th Annual Dance Magazine Awards,"<!-- Bot generated title -->] November 5, 2013.</ref> and Cue's Golden Apple Award in 1977. An Award for Arts and Culture, City of New York, 1981. The title of Knight of the [[Order of the Dannebrog]] in 1983. An award of Merit, Philadelphia Art Alliance, 1985. And a Liberty Award, 1986. He was nominated for the 1986 [[Tony Award]] for Best Choreographer for ''[[Song & Dance]]''. Martins is a champion of contemporary music, working often with composer [[John Adams (composer)|John Adams]]. His autobiography, ''Far From Denmark'' was published in 1982. Martins was named Man of the Year by the Danish American Society, 1980. His exercise regimen, titled ''NYCB Workout'' and designed with the [[New York Sports Club]], first appeared in book form in 1997, with a DVD and a sequel produced later. Martins was inducted into the [[National Museum of Dance and Hall of Fame|National Museum of Dance's Mr. & Mrs. Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney Hall of Fame]] in 2008.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.dancemuseum.org/exhibits/hof.html|title=National Museum of Dance & Hall of Fame|website=www.dancemuseum.org|access-date=2018-01-14}}</ref>
==Personal life==
Martins had a longterm romantic relationship with [[Heather Watts]] during her career as a principal dancer with the New York City Ballet.<ref name=autogenerated9>[http://www.wral.com/five-dancers-accuse-city-ballet-s-peter-martins-of-physical-abuse/17181967/?comment_order=forward Five dancers accuse city ballet’s peter martins of physical abuse :: WRAL.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> [[John Clifford (choreographer)|John Clifford]], a principal dancer and choreographer under [[George Balanchine]], recalled "I saw him pick her up and slam her into a cement wall."<ref name=autogenerated9 /> In ballerina [[Gelsey Kirkland]]'s book ''Dancing on My Grave'' (1986), she describes Martins dragging Watts up and down a flight of stairs.<ref>[http://www.dancemagazine.com/peter-martins-leave-absence-accusations-2515881048.html Peter Martins Is Taking A Leave of Absence As More Accusations Surface - dancemagazine<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
He was first married to Lisa La Cour, a ballerina he danced with at the Royal Ballet of Denmark. He had a child with her, Nilas. They met while they were both with the Royal Ballet of Denmark and after their divorce, he was a guest-artist with the New York City Ballet and eventually defected to America to dance with the latter company full-time. Nilas eventually followed his father to America, to New York City and to the New York City Ballet.
In July 1992, Martins was arrested and held for five hours after his 28-year-old wife of seven months, New York City Ballet principal ballerina [[Darci Kistler]], phoned the police for help. His wife filed an affidavit accusing him of assaulting her, pushing and slapping her, and cutting and bruising her arms and legs and continuing to hit her after she fell under his attack.<ref name=autogenerated6/><ref name=autogenerated10>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/ballet-chief-peter-martins-under-investigation-after-sexual-harassment-allegations/2017/12/04/a474eae6-d3a3-11e7-a986-d0a9770d9a3e_story.html Ballet chief Peter Martins under investigation after sexual harassment allegations - The Washington Post<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref name=autogenerated8/> He was charged with third-degree [[assault]] (a misdemeanor).<ref name=autogenerated8>[https://www.upi.com/Archives/1992/07/22/Ballerina-drops-assault-charges-against-husband/8361711777600/ "Ballerina drops assault charges against husband,"<!-- Bot generated title -->] UPI, July 22, 1992.</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1992/07/22/nyregion/martins-ballet-master-held-on-charge-he-beat-his-wife.html|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=July 22, 1992|title=Martins, Ballet Master, Held On Charge He Beat His Wife}}</ref><ref name=autogenerated6>[https://pagesix.com/2007/02/11/ballet-legend-almost-got-boot/ "Ballet Legend Almost Got Boot" | Page Six,<!-- Bot generated title -->] ''New York Post'', February 11, 2007.</ref> Kistler dropped the charges a few days later, saying she preferred to resolve the matter without the court's intervention.<ref name=autogenerated8 /><ref name=autogenerated6 /><ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=7EM-AQAAIAAJ&q=%22Peter+Martins%22+assault+wife&dq=%22Peter+Martins%22+assault+wife&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiL-_Gkz7rYAhUpRN8KHb0-CMAQ6AEIPTAE ''Vogue''<!-- Bot generated title -->], Vol. 188, 1998.</ref> When she next performed in a ballet two days later, she reportedly wore heavy makeup to conceal bruises she had suffered.<ref name=autogenerated8 /> Several people who knew the two well claimed it wasn't the first time Martins had hit her.<ref>Scott J. Paltrow (December 6, 1992). [http://articles.latimes.com/1992-12-06/magazine/tm-3085_1_city-ballet/2 "Peter Martins, Off Balance: In the Wake of Last Summer's Wife-Beating Scandal, Can the New York City Ballet's Artistic Director Get Back on His Toes?",<!-- Bot generated title -->] ''Los Angeles Times'', page 2.</ref> Peter Wolff, a member of the school’s board of directors, said that the assault charge was "a personal matter", would not affect Martins’ career, and that it had "nothing to do with his competency or his support in the ballet community."<ref name=autogenerated10 />
In 2011, Martins was charged with [[DWI]] in [[Yonkers]].<ref name=autogenerated11>[http://www.lohud.com/story/news/crime/2018/01/08/peter-martins-ex-nyc-ballet-leader-dwi-charge-ardsley/1012669001/ Irvington's Peter Martins faces drunken driving charge in Ardsley<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> He pleaded guilty to a reduced charge of [[driving while impaired]].<ref name=autogenerated11 /> In December 2017, Martins was arrested after a three-car crash and charged with [[drunk driving]], refusal to take a breath test, and backing unsafely.<ref name=autogenerated11 /> He pleaded not guilty in [[Ardsley, New York|Ardsley Village]] Court, and his license was suspended.<ref name=autogenerated11 />
Kistler and Martins have one daughter, Talicia Tove Martins, born June 13, 1996.<ref>Nadine Brozan (June 14, 1996). [https://www.nytimes.com/1996/06/14/style/chronicle-018198.html "Chronicle"] , ''The New York Times''.</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://bangordailynews.com/2017/08/07/news/police-beat/socialite-daughter-of-famous-ballet-couple-busted-for-maine-burglaries/|newspaper=[[Bangor Daily News]]|date=August 7, 2017|title=Socialite daughter of famous ballet couple busted for Maine burglaries|author=Alex Acquisto}}</ref><ref name=autogenerated5>Chris Perez (August 7, 2017). [https://nypost.com/2017/08/07/rich-daughter-of-ballet-stars-busted-in-burglary-spree/ "Rich daughter of ballet stars busted in burglary spree,"<!-- Bot generated title -->] ''New York Post''.</ref> He has a son, Nilas Martins, who also was a member of NYCB before himself retiring. <ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2010/07/23/arts/dance/23arts-NILASMARTINS_BRF.html</ref>
In July 2007, his 40-year-old son Nilas was arrested for [[Drug possession|possession of cocaine]]. <ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2007/07/06/arts/06arts-CITYBALLETDA_BRF.html</ref> He pleaded guilty to disorderly conduct and was sentenced to 40 hours of community service, to undergo drug and alcohol evaluation, and was fined $295. <ref>https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/08/09/AR2007080900751.html?noredirect=on</ref>
In July 2017, his 21-year-old daughter Talicia was arrested for committing [[Burglaries|burglaries]] at several businesses in [[Maine]] with her 20-year-old friend Jacob Flanagan, stealing thousands of dollars, and for being under the influence of drugs and alcohol.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Bucher|first1=Chris|title=Talicia Martins & Jacob Flanagan: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know|url=https://heavy.com/news/2017/08/talicia-martins-jacob-flanagan-burglary-arrested-ballet-peter-darci-parents-photos-instagram/|publisher=heavy.com|accessdate=22 March 2018}}</ref> She had already been arrested in June 2017 for drug possession in New York, where she was caught with [[Crack cocaine|crack cocaine]], [[heroin]] and a [[hypodermic needle]] in her parents’ Manhattan apartment on [[West End Avenue]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Schladebeck|first1=Jessica|title=Daughter of famous New York ballet stars arrested for burglaries in Maine|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/daughter-famous-new-york-ballet-stars-arrested-burglaries-article-1.3393432|accessdate=22 March 2018}}</ref> Talicia was presented as a debutante at [[Le Bal des Débutantes]], a debutante ball in Paris, in 2012.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ball|first1=Crillon|title=2012|url=https://www.lebal.events/le-bal-des-debutantes-2012/|accessdate=22 March 2018}}</ref>

revision.text:
{{Infobox| above = SBS Swiss Business School | image1 = [[File:SBS Swiss Business School (logo).jpg|250px]] | header1 = About the School | label2 = '''Type:''' | data2 = Private | label3 = '''President:''' | data3 = Dr. Craig Shoemaker
(Honorary President) | label4 = '''Vice President:''' | data4 = Marijana Karanfiloska | label5 = '''Dean:''' | data5 = Bert Wolfs, Ph.D. | label6 = '''Faculty:''' | data6 = 48 | label7 = '''Students:''' | data7 = 937 (2016) | label8 = '''Location:''' | data8 = [[Zurich]], Switzerland | label9 = '''Website:''' | data9 = [https://www.sbs.edu www.sbs.edu] | label10 = '''Accreditation:''' | data10 = BAC/ACBSP/IACBE }} '''SBS Swiss Business School''' is a private business school located in [[Zurich]], [[Switzerland]] with affiliated campuses in Latvia, Kazakhstan, United Arab Emirates, Hong Kong, Argentina, India.{{cite journal |title=SBS Swiss Business School|url=http://www.avanzaentucarrera.com/centro/sbs-swiss-business-school/36925/|journal=Avanza en tu carrera}} == History == SBS Swiss Business School was founded in 1998{{cite journal |title=Swiss Business School|url=http://www.universitieshandbook.com/directory/canton-zurich/swiss-business-school|journal=Universities Handbook}} as a private{{cite journal |title=SBS Swiss Business School Phd Portal|url=http://www.phdportal.eu/universities/1248/sbs-swiss-business-school.html|journal=PHD portal}} institution.{{cite journal |title=About Swiss Business School|url=http://www.intercontinentaleducation.com/about-swiss-business-school|journal=Intercontinental Education}} == Academic Programs == SBS Swiss Business School offers a variety of programs. All academic programs are taught in English. SBS delivers [[undergraduate]], [[Graduate school|graduate]] and [[doctoral]] programs such as [[Bachelor]], [[Master's degree|Master]] and [[Doctoral]] degrees. Undergraduate and graduate programs are proposed in several disciplines, including [[Business administration]], E-Commerce and [[Science]]. An Executive MBA, an Online MBA and a Doctorate Program in [[Business Administration]] are also available.{{cite journal |title=SBS Profile - Last update February the 5th 2014|url=http://www.aasbi.com/bschool-profiles/SBS-profile/sbs.html|journal=AASBI}}{{cite journal |title=Master Portal SBS Swiss Business School|url=http://www.mastersportal.eu/universities/1248/sbs-swiss-business-school.html|journal=Mastersportal}}{{cite journal |title=School Directory SBS Swiss Business School|url=http://www.sestudyabroad.com/school/sbs-swiss-business-school/|journal=sestudyabroad}}{{cite journal |title=SBS Swiss Business School Learn4good|url=http://www.learn4good.com/reviews/switzerland/zuerich/business-training-schools/1957/reviews.htm|journal=Learn4good}} == Accreditation Status == SBS Swiss Business School programs are accredited by the [[British Accreditation Council]] (BAC){{cite journal|title=BAC Accredited Providers|url=http://www.the-bac.org/directory/17921/sbs-swiss-business-school/}} [[Association of Collegiate Business Schools and Programs]] (ACBSP){{cite journal |title=Accredited programs ACBSP, updated January the 7th 2014|url=http://www.acbsp.org/?page=accredited_members|journal=ACBSP}} and the [[International Assembly for Collegiate Business Education]] ([[IACBE]]),{{cite journal |title=IACBE Membership Status|url=http://www.iacbe.org/memberpdf/SBSSwissBusinessSchool.pdf|journal=IACBE}}. Both these US-wide accreditation bodies have been recognized by the [[Council for Higher Education Accreditation]] (CHEA) as a [[List of recognized higher education accreditation organizations#Programmatic accreditation|programmatic accrediting organization]]. SBS Swiss Business School is listed in the database of "Accredited Programs by Program Type or Accrediting Organization". {{cite journal|title=CHEA Database Search|url=http://www.chea.org/4DCGI/chea/search/programs.html?Action=chea&chea_activity=program_search&MenuKey=main|journal=CHEA}}] SBS Swiss Business School is certified by [[EduQua]], the Swiss Quality Assurance Certificate for providers in the field of adult learning. == Memberships == SBS Swiss Business School has joined the [[Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business]] (AACSB International),{{cite journal |title=AACSB Members in Switzerland|url=http://www.aacsb.edu/membership/listings/all-educational-members/?F_Country=Switzerland|journal=AACSB}} the Swiss Adult Education Association (SVEB),{{cite journal |title=SVEB|url=http://www.alice.ch|journal=Alice}} the Swiss Federation of Private Schools (VSP),{{cite journal |title=Swiss Federation of Private Schools - Members|url=http://www.swiss-schools.ch/index.php/en/vsp-mitglieder|journal=Swiss-schools}} the Swiss Conference of Higher Education,{{cite journal |title=Swiss Conference of Higher Education - Members|url=http://www.k-hf.ch/schulen/membres-mitglieder-membri|journal=k-hf}} the Swiss Private School Register,{{cite journal |title=Swiss Private School Register|url=http://www.swissprivateschoolregister.com|journal=Swiss private school register}} and a member of the [[Central and East European Management Development Association]] (CEEMAN) based in Slovenia, but not accredited,{{cite journal |title=CEEMAN Institutional Members|url=http://www.ceeman.org/about-us/ceeman-members/ceeman-institutional-members#12b4528c-8648-4cdb-b023-baac3bd5cbf2|journal=CEEMAN}}. == Rankings == Since 2012, the MBA programs of SBS Swiss Business School have been ranked as tier one MBA programs by the CEO Magazine Global MBA Rankings.{{cite journal |title=CEO Magazine - MBA Rankings 2016|url=http://www.ceo-mag.com/rankings-category/global-mba-rankings/|journal=CEO Magazine}} The Online MBA Program of SBS Swiss Business School has been ranked 2nd place in the 2016 CEO Magazine Global Online MBA Rankings.{{cite journal |title=CEO Magazine - MBA Rankings 2016|url=http://www.ceo-mag.com/rankings-category/global-mba-rankings/|journal=CEO Magazine}} The DBA program of SBS has been ranked 18th place by the European Economic Committee, Global DBA Rankings EURO 2016.{{cite journal |title=European Economic Committee - Global DBA Rankings EURO 2016|url=http://www.europestudy.org/index.php/eu-ratings/dba|journal=Global DBA Rankings EURO 2016}} SBS Swiss Business School was awarded as "Most innovative Business School in Switzerland" offering the "Best Remote Learning Programme in Europe by European CEO 2012,{{cite journal|title=European CEO - Global Business Education Awards 2012|url=http://www.europeanceo.com/home/award-winners/2013/04/global-business-education-awards-2012/|journal=European CEO|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130608134126/http://www.europeanceo.com/home/award-winners/2013/04/global-business-education-awards-2012/|archivedate=2013-06-08|df=}} its MBA Program has been ranked 14th in Europe by CEO Magazine 2012 and the Online MBA has been listed in the ''[[Financial Times]]'' 2009 online MBA list.{{cite journal |title=Online MBA 2009 Listing ''Financial Times''|url=http://rankings.ft.com/businessschoolrankings/online-mba-2009|journal=Rankings}} == Partner Institutions == SBS Swiss Business School is a partner institutions with the [[Russian-Armenian State University]] in [[Yerevan]] - [[Armenia]], the Acelin Institute of Business in [[Adelaide]] - Australia, the International Business School in [[Almaty]] - [[Kazakhstan]], the Ramaiah Institute of Management Studies in [[Bangalore]] - India, the [[BA School of Business and Finance]] in [[Riga]]{{cite journal|title=Universities Handbook Partners of Riga Business School|url=http://www.universitieshandbook.com/directory/partners/riga-business-school|journal=Universitieshandbook|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150227030421/http://www.universitieshandbook.com/directory/partners/riga-business-school|archivedate=2015-02-27|df=}} - [[Latvia]], the Academy of National Economy in [[Moscow]] - Russia, [[St. Ambrose University]] in [[Davenport, Iowa]] - United States and Al-Tareeqah Management Studies in the United Arab Emirates. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.sbs.edu Official homepage] {{coord|47.45344|8.579937|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sbs Swiss Business School}} [[Category:Business schools in Europe]] [[Category:Education in Switzerland]] [[Category:Business schools in Switzerland]]
